conversation.content: [quietly seething] Encontré la bypass valve que instalaste en la línea principal de riego, Marcus. Tres meses robando agua, documentado con medidores que muestran exactamente cuánto has estado desviando.
[defensive] Mira, el cultivo necesitaba más agua de la que permitían los permisos, and you know how these drought restrictions are killing small operations like mine.
¿Operaciones pequeñas? Estás cultivando dos acres de cannabis ilegal detrás de ese almacén, robando agua de familias que sí respetan las restricciones. [bitter laugh]
Esas familias no entienden las oportunidades de negocio cuando las tienen delante. Además, I was planning to pay back the district once the harvest came in.
[doubtfully] ¿Devolverlo? Has robado aproximadamente 400,000 galones según mis cálculos. Son 12,000 dólares en tarifas comerciales que has evitado, sin mencionar las sanciones penales.
[dismissive] Tus cálculos seguramente están mal. Besides, Sarah doesn't need to know about this little misunderstanding between family members, ¿verdad?
Mi hermana ya lo sabe. [exhales] Tuve que decírselo antes de presentar el informe al distrito de aguas mañana por la mañana. The inspectors will be there by noon.
[suddenly concerned] Espera, ¿en serio vas a denunciar a tu propio cuñado? Piensa en lo que esto le hace a la familia, a tus sobrinos.
¿Pensaste en ellos cuando decidiste que robar a la comunidad valía la pena? Los niveles del acuífero están en mínimos históricos, Marcus.
[scoffing] El acuífero se recuperará con las lluvias de invierno. Vosotros los ingenieros siempre os ponéis histéricos con estas cosas, but nature finds a way.
¿La naturaleza encuentra su camino?
[fake sincerity] Mira, aprecio todo lo que has hecho por esta familia, de verdad. Maybe we can work something out without involving the authorities.
Las lecturas falsificadas que presentaste, los informes de inspección falsificados con mi firma—has estado planeando esto desde que te mudaste aquí el año pasado.
[desperately bargaining] Desconectaré todo esta noche, pagaré la multa que creas justa. Podemos manejarlo discretamente, professionally even.

[coldly professional] El agua que robaste podría haber abastecido a treinta hogares durante todo el periodo de sequía del verano. Those are real families who had to cut back while you ran grow lights twenty-four seven.
[falsely contrite] Tienes razón, cometí errores. Pero destruir mi vida por algo de agua parece extremo, ¿no crees?

[incredulous] ¿Algo de agua? Cada galón que robaste venía de las reservas de emergencia para la extinción de incendios. [pause] Literalmente jugaste con las vidas de la gente por tus márgenes de beneficio.
Sarah me va a dejar si esto se hace público. [manipulative pause] ¿Es eso lo que quieres para tu hermana, que sea madre soltera por tus principios rígidos?

[firmly resolved] Ya está haciendo las maletas. El abogado de divorcios que contrató se especializa en protección de activos, especially when one spouse commits felonies that could trigger civil lawsuits.

[bitterly laughing] Debería haber sabido que la pondrías en mi contra también. Los ingenieros y vuestros preciosos datos, vuestros sagrados diagramas de flujo. You never understood what it takes to actually make money.

original_conversation.content: [quietly seething] I found the bypass valve you installed on the main irrigation line, Marcus. Three months of water theft, documented with flow meters showing exactly how much you've been siphoning off.
[defensive] Look, the crop needed more water than the permits allowed, and you know how these drought restrictions are killing small operations like mine.
Small operations? You're running two acres of illegal cannabis behind that warehouse, stealing water from families who actually follow the rationing guidelines. [bitter laugh]
Those families don't understand business opportunities when they see them. Besides, I was planning to pay back the district once the harvest came in.
[doubtfully] Pay it back? You've stolen approximately 400,000 gallons based on my calculations. That's $12,000 in commercial water rates you've avoided, not to mention the criminal penalties.
[dismissive] Your calculations are probably off. Besides, Sarah doesn't need to know about this little misunderstanding between family members, right?
My sister already knows. [exhales] I had to tell her before filing the report with the water district tomorrow morning. The inspectors will be there by noon.
[suddenly concerned] Wait, you're seriously going to report your own brother-in-law? Think about what this does to the family, to your nephews.
You thought about them when you decided stealing from the community was worth the risk? The aquifer levels are at historic lows, Marcus.
[scoffing] The aquifer will recover with winter rains. You engineers always panic about these things, but nature finds a way.
Nature finds a way?
[fake sincerity] Look, I appreciate everything you've done for this family, really. Maybe we can work something out without involving the authorities.
The falsified meter readings you submitted, the forged inspection reports with my signature—you've been planning this since you moved here last year.
[desperately bargaining] I'll disconnect everything tonight, pay whatever fine you think is fair. We can handle this quietly, professionally even.

[coldly professional] The water you stole could have supplied thirty households through the entire summer drought period. Those are real families who had to cut back while you ran grow lights twenty-four seven.
[falsely contrite] You're right, I made mistakes. But destroying my life over some water seems extreme, don't you think?
[incredulous] Some water? Every gallon you stole came from emergency reserves meant for fire suppression. [pause] You literally gambled with people's lives for your profit margins.
Sarah's going to leave me if this goes public. [manipulative pause] Is that what you want for your sister, to be a single mother because of your rigid principles?
[firmly resolved] She's already packing. The divorce lawyer she hired specializes in asset protection, especially when one spouse commits felonies that could trigger civil lawsuits.
[bitterly laughing] Should've known you'd turn her against me too. Engineers and their precious data, their sacred flow charts. You never understood what it takes to actually make money.

scenario: A water resources engineer confronts their brother-in-law who has been stealing water from the community irrigation system for his failing marijuana grow operation.
